Posts

  • Feb 19, 2020

    Release 0.3.0

    First release for iOS beta!

  • Feb 6, 2020

    Retrospective on Launching the Public Beta for auToDo

    Yesterday marked a very important milestone in auToDo’s journey. The app was made available to the public for the first time! It was released only for Android and as a beta release, so it isn’t quite a fully public app yet. This is still a big step up from the 3 users the app had before yesterday (including me) though!

  • Feb 3, 2020

    Release 0.2.0

    First release to the public beta!

  • Feb 2, 2020

    Release 0.1.9

    Variety of bugfixes for the signup process.

  • Jan 26, 2020

    Release 0.1.8

    Improved a variety of minor UX annoyances.

  • Jan 24, 2020

    YC Startup School Week 1

    This week I started in on Y Combinator’s Startup School program with the intention of launching auToDo soon. I have the knowledge and experience to write the app for auToDo, but that is definitely not the case for the other aspects of turning it into a successful business. Startup School’s goal is to make it easier for people like myself to navigate the confusing time of starting and running a startup, and I fully intend to make the most of it.

  • Jan 20, 2020

    Release 0.1.7

    Hotfix for bug found in user testing where a previously signed-in user could not access the home screen.

  • Jan 19, 2020

    Release 0.1.6

    No visible changes.

  • Jan 18, 2020

    Release 0.1.5

    Major overhaul of the app’s business logic, so the number of noticeable bugs should be much lower than before.

  • Dec 1, 2019

    Release 0.1.4

    Improvements targeted at improving the sign up and sign in UX.

  • Nov 24, 2019

    Release 0.1.3

    auToDo is now doing a much better job of keeping statistics on your car’s refueling history. You can view these stats in the Statistics tab on the home screen, and the stats are used to make sure that notifications for your upcoming ToDo items are delivered on time.

  • Nov 19, 2019

    Release 0.1.2

    A variety of much needed bug-fixes. This release is available to alpha testers on the Google Play Store.
